transcript.text: Think of the rivers of blood spilled by all those generals and emperors so that

transcript.text: in glory and triumph they could become the momentary masters of a fraction of a dot.

transcript.text: Think of the endless cruelties visited by the inhabitants of one corner of this

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: pixel on the scarcely distinguishable inhabitants of some other corner,

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: how frequent their misunderstandings, how eager they are to kill one another,

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: how fervent their hatreds.

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: Our posturings, our imagined self-importance, the delusion that we have some

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: privileged position in the universe are challenged by this point of pale light.

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: Our planet is a lonely speck in the great enveloping cosmic dark.

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: In our obscurity, in all this vastness, there is no hint that help will come

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: from elsewhere to save us from ourselves.

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: The earth is the only world known so far to harbor life.

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: There is nowhere else, at least in the near future, to which our species could migrate.

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: Visit? Yes.

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: Settle? Not yet.

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: Like it or not, for the moment, the Earth is where we make our stand.

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: It has been said that astronomy is a humbling and character-building experience.

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: There is perhaps no better demonstration of the folly of human conceits than

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: this distant image of our tiny world.

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: To me, it underscores our responsibility to deal more kindly with one another

transcript.speaker: Soundboard
transcript.text: and to preserve and cherish the pale blue dot, the only home we've ever known.
